messages.message: I’ve noticed that the anomaly overlay sometimes hides critical labels in the high-density zones. We might need a new design approach.

replies.message: That’s a good point. Maybe we can try dynamic opacity adjustments based on the density of anomalies?
Dynamic opacity sounds doable. I can prototype this in the next iteration.
We should document the pros and cons of this approach in the Confluence design page.

messages.message: I’ve started a draft on Notion for the Dallas deployment checklist: https://notion.nvidia.com/retail-safety/deployment-checklist. Feel free to add suggestions.

replies.message: Thanks, Priya! I’ll add the fallback mechanism steps to the checklist.
I’ll include validation points for the anomaly overlays.

messages.message: Has anyone reviewed the performance logs for the Jetson Xavier NX? I noticed some discrepancies in processing times.
I’ve started comparing the logs with the previous deployment metrics. It seems like the preprocessing pipeline might be slower in specific scenarios.

replies.message: Is this happening more during high-traffic simulation tests?
Yes, exactly. I think optimizing the data loader could help.
Would batching frames differently improve this? We had similar issues with the face recognition project.

messages.message: I’ve scheduled a QA session for tomorrow afternoon to validate the updated bounding box logic. Let me know if there are additional test cases we should include.

replies.message: Could you test overlapping anomalies in high-density areas? That seems to be a recurring edge case.
Also, let’s include scenarios with inconsistent lighting conditions. Those have been tricky in the past.

messages.message: FYI, I’ve updated the Confluence page on fallback mechanisms with input from our earlier discussion. Please review before the next team sync.

replies.message: I’ll take a look tonight and add notes on handling false positives.
Thanks, Diana. I’ll focus on the section about escalation triggers.

messages.message: Do we need to present any key metrics from the Dallas deployment to leadership next week?

replies.message: Yes, we should include anomaly detection accuracy and latency improvements.
I’ll prepare a slide deck with those metrics and share a draft tomorrow.
